cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 315 mi (510 km) SE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move west-northwest today, turn northwest late Sunday, then north-northwest into the southeastern Gulf of Mexico and toward the Florida peninsula / Big Bend region mid-week

weather_observation.watch_coast: No U.S. coastal watches in effect in this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: No U.S. coastal warnings in effect in this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula and Keys likely to experience tropical-storm conditions mid-week; east-central Florida (including Canaveral) in 4–5-day cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–63 kt) have a 50 % chance of occurring within 5 days; earliest onset around early Tuesday with highest threat late Wednesday-Thursday. 21 % chance of 50 kt winds by Thursday morning.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If Ian crosses the peninsula and emerges near or just north of the port, onshore flow could push 2–4 ft of surge into the Banana & Indian Rivers and Port Canaveral channel late week.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy bands could bring 4–8 inches locally late Wednesday–Friday, causing fresh-water flooding in low-lying port facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas and dangerous surf/rip currents beginning mid-week; potential port closure or Condition Yankee/Zulu preparations.
